newsitem.title: TURKEY: POLL - Turks expect higher June inflation.
newsitem.headline: POLL - Turks expect higher June inflation.

text.p: Turkish bankers and economists expect June month-on-month inflation to be higher than a year earlier, according to Reuters poll.

Poll results, based on predictions of four banks, five brokerage houses and three economists, showed that estimates centred On the range of 3.5-4.0 percent for the June consumer price rise and a 4.0-4.5 percent range for wholesale prices.
Consumer prices rose 2.5 percent from a month earlier in June 1996 and wholesale prices were up 2.7 percent. The rises were 4.7 percent and 5.2 percent in May, respectively.
Economists say monetary expansion and public sector price rises in April will be reflected in June inflation.
